alert.note: Alert for Northern Hidalgo; Southern Hidalgo (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 4:24PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Hidalgo and southeastern Starr Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 424 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mccook, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mission, Palmview, Penitas, Sullivan City, La Joya, Palmhurst, Sharyland, Mccook, Alton and Narciso G. Cavazos Elementary School. This includes US Highway 83 between mile markers 838 and 842, and between mile markers 846 and 850. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
